text:
To address a few points: 
• the “best” answer to a newcomers question is one they don’t need to ask on slack/SO/discourse in the first place. Having to join a Slack and ask is 100% friction and a barrier to entry
• not obnoxious by default but feel free to suggest ways (without disabling it) that make it less so 
• Maintainers didn’t want to close helpdesk, it was my initiative (with support from a couple of people) so I will take the blame for that, this is a surly a better solution and I’m very glad we didn’t go down that route. I use slack everyday for what it’s worth
• Repeating answers over and over is something you should be able to do for fun or the like if you want, but the default should not be such that we need not to do that 
we are trying to build something for everyone, including and especially folks not active or on slack right now. That’s why the bot exists, it’s not for you, it’s not for me, it’s for all of the folks outside of here. We get the great experience of spending time together in here chatting that most folks in the community will not experience
• The diversity angle on this is a prime motivator 
I appreciate all your candid thoughts, please continue to open issues here: <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge|https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge> and I’ll keep trying to make things better

What people perceive as obnoxious is subjective. You cannot declare it to be so and it is true. I find it obnoxious and I think I'm not alone. My fear seems correct. Michael was right. You are actively trying to defer people away from <#C6A044SQH|helpdesk>.
